info.author: Danny Yoo
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
info.description: The Aho-Corasick automaton is a data structure that can quickly do a multiple-keyword search across text. It's described in the classic paper 'Efficient string matching: an aid to bibliographic search': http://portal.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=360855&dl=ACM&coll=GUIDE. The majority of the code here is adapted from source code from the Fairly Fast Packet Filter (FFPF) project: http://ffpf.sourceforge.net/general/overview.php.
info.name: ahocorasick
info.html_description: The Aho-Corasick automaton is a data structure that can quickly do a multiple-keyword search across text. It’s described in the classic paper ‘Efficient string matching: an aid to bibliographic search’: http://portal.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=360855&dl=ACM&coll=GUIDE. The majority of the code here is adapted from source code from the Fairly Fast Packet Filter (FFPF) project: http://ffpf.sourceforge.net/general/overview.php.
